speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: Hey, now we're talking.

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: Hey. Right here, man, right here!

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: Hey, come on! Stop, you son of a...

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: You know, you got, like, highway hypnosis or something. You didn't see me standing there, yelling, waving?

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: You better watch that.

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: Oh, come on. What now?

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: Where's everybody going?

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: Is, is the toilet broken? What?

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: Can someone please tell me what's going on here?

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: No!

speaker: HANK GULATARSKI
line: No! No!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Damn.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: John Doggett.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, it's Scully. Good morning.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Good afternoon. I've been trying to reach you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, actually, I'm out of town. I'm … north of Sugarville, Utah, roughly.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Utah? What are you doing there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The, uh, local coroner wants a consultation on a murder victim.... a man who was found beaten to death in the desert. Apparently, his corpse shows some anomalous characteristics.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Anomalous? How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: From what they're telling me, he is a, uh, 22-year-old backpacker who was last seen by his family about six months ago in perfect health. However, his body is now showing advanced signs of osteoporosis, arthritis, and kyphosis of the vertebrae. In other words, he's got a spine of a 90-year-old woman.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sounds anomalous, all right. You didn't need me to tag along?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it was just a, uh, a simple consultation... and, uh... he called me over the weekend and I figured I wasn't going to bother you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, if there's anything I can do from here…

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, actually, there might be, if you don't mind. Somewhere in our files... there is a, uh, an unsolved murder case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unfortunately, I , uh, don't remember any of the particulars like where or when it took place but I do remember that there were some glycoproteins found at the crime scene.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: "Glycoproteins."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, mucous... But it was, uh, unable to be identified, and seeing as how you, uh, recently read through all of our files I thought maybe it would ring a bell with you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I don't have a great memory for mucous... but I'll be happy to look.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Remember anything else? Are you still there? Agent Scully? Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Do you remember anything else?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, no, no, just, uh, just mucous. Look, when you find that file, will you fax it over to the Juab County Sheriff's office? That's the best place to reach me. My cell phone doesn't seem to be working out here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right, you got it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: How you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good … thanks. I, uh, I was wondering. A bus came through here a little while ago. Uh, do you happen to know where it might have gone?

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Well, I was around back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know what's up that road?

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Eventually it'll get you to Salt Lake... I mean, if you're not in too much a hurry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, can I ask what happened to your hand?

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Aww… I was changing the blade on my bow saw. It's kind of gross.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. There was a, uh, murder out here last week about 15, 20 miles off the state road. Did you, uh, did you hear about it?

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Yes, I did. It's scary.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Well, you're going to want to wash this out. Put some iodine on it. You don't want it to get infected.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: You sound like my mother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, well, I also sound like a doctor.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Medical doctor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Can you sell me some gas?

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Oh. Oh, I'd love to... but I'm all out. See, the tanker was supposed to be here yesterday but... well, I'm hoping for this afternoon. How low are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got a... quarter tank, I think. I'll make it. It's all right.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: I'd feel awful bad if you didn't. Hang on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thanks.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Should be enough in here to tide you over.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, that's great. Thank you.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Do me a favor. Don't go telling people that I'm giving away free gas back here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is "here," exactly? 'Cause I can't seem to find this town on the map.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Oh, we're not really a town. Just a... just a few like-minded people trying to keep the modern world at bay.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: You're good to go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you very much.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Help is coming.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey. Excuse me. You put something in my tank that killed my engine.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's that gas can? I'd like to see it, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's water. I barely even smell any gasoline.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: Oh, God, you're right. I'm sorry. I... I left it out. It must have gotten rain in it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, and it rains a lot here, does it? Seeing as how it's basically the desert.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: I'm really sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I'm going to use your phone.

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: I don't have one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't have a phone. So how did you call up the tanker that was supposed to come here yesterday?

speaker: GAS STATION MAN
line: There's a phone up the street. Mr. Milsap's place. He'll help you out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello? Hello?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Milsap?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I hope so. My, uh, car has stalled up the street and I was wondering if I could use your phone.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Sure. It's in here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The line's dead.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Oh, no. Let me see.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Damn phone company. They're updating the lines, so the service gets interrupted. It'll come back on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How long?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Ten minutes... two hours... I could say, but I'd just be guessing.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: You're welcome to wait here. I could even give you a room if you like. This was a boarding house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I won't be here that long.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell is going on here?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Sorry?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I get the distinct impression that somebody doesn't want me to leave.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: I don't know anything about that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A bus came through here about an hour ago. Where did it go?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: A bus?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't tell me you didn't see it.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Oh, I think I'd have known if a big bus came through. Are you sure I can't help you out with a room?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: It's 18 miles to the state road. Another 20 to Sugarville.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: You don't want to walk it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me. Ma'am, excuse me. Ma'am. Excuse me, ma'am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello? Ma'am, I need some help.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Doctor, can I speak to you? It's... it's an emergency.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: I'm sorry to bother you. There's a man downstairs that needs help. Please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let go. Don't hold him down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How long has he been seizing?

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Uh, three... four minutes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's okay. You're all right. You're okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's his name?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: He's a stranger. He needed help.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Wha... what's wrong with him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He had a grand mal seizure. As far as I can tell, he's in status. It's a continuous seizure state. He doesn't smell like acetone, which would indicate that he's hyperglycemic and … uh … he doesn't appear to have any head injuries. He could be epileptic and just ceased taking his medication.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did this happen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh-huh. At any rate, we need to get him to a hospital. Immediately.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I assume that your phone's still not working.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, do you or one of your "friendly" neighbors happen to have a car?

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: No one here has a car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No cars?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: We could send someone to the state road on foot. All right? We could get them to bring back help.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: In the meantime, please, anything you can do for him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, do you... um … do you have any Karo syrup? Any corn syrup?

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: Joab County Sheriff's office, Sheriff Ciolino speaking.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, hi, this is Agent John Doggett with the FBI. I have some material my partner, Agent Scully, requested. What's your fax number there?

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: Agent Doggett, uh, when's your partner going to get here, by the way? The murder victim's family's waiting for us to turn the body over.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully's not there? She's supposed to be there yesterday.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: Yes, sir, that was our understanding.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sheriff, could I trouble you to send a car out? Agent Scully –is- in Utah. She called me yesterday somewhere north of Sugarville.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: You got it. I'll get someone right out there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Okay, thanks. I'll be in touch.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Danny, hi. This is John Doggett. I need

speaker: YOU TO TRACE A CALL FOR ME.  IT CAME TO THIS OFFICE YESTERDAY ABOUT 1
line: 30 in the afternoon.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Am I doing this right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, you can hold off now.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Nothing's happening.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, but, uh... I'm just winging it here. I mean, raising his blood sugar only helps if his condition is brought on by hypoglycemia, but this could be the result of any number of things.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: So what do we do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'm afraid that I have done all that I can do … unless you know how to get ahold of diazepam or phenobarbital other than the nearest hospital … which is where we should be, of course.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, hey. Can you hear me? How are you feeling?

speaker: HANK
line: Okay.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Thank God. Thank God. We were all so scared.

speaker: HANK
line: I think I just need rest.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: We should leave him alone.

speaker: HANK
line: Can, uh, you stay?

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: I'll go tell everybody.

speaker: HANK
line: Are you a doctor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. I am.

speaker: HANK
line: Thank you. For, uh, helping me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'm not sure if I've actually done anything. In fact, I don't even know, uh, I don't even know what's going on with you right now. Do you know what your name is?

speaker: HANK
line: Um…

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't remember do you? How about how you got here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about these people who have taken you in? Do you know anything about them?

speaker: HANK
line: Um, they, uh, take good care of me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I'll say they take very good care of you. The sun seems to rise and set on you as far as they're concerned. In fact, they seem to have stranded me here in order to nurse you back to health.

speaker: HANK
line: What … why would they do that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A murder took place about 20 miles from here. A man was stoned to death. His head was so badly crushed, that they couldn't identify him from his teeth. Now it looks like upwards of a dozen people may have participated due to the footprints at the crime scene, but it's a very tight knit group of people who would murder together. A cult, in a word. And I'd say that these people qualify.

speaker: HANK
line: What are you? Detective?

speaker: SCULLY
line: FBI. And I need to get you out of here, but I don't know how. Okay, do you think that you can you walk?

speaker: HANK
line: I don't know. Kind of weak.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I understand.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hang … hang on a second. Just let me look at something, okay?

speaker: HANK
line: Mmmm?

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right.

speaker: HANK
line: That thing hurts! Maybe you shouldn't do that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hold on, hold on.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Doggett.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: It's Ciolino. We checked out the number you gave us. It's a pay phone a half-mile from the crime scene.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully must've just come from there when she called me.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: Looks like. We're sorry. Still no sign of her.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Are you canvassing? Talking to NAVIS?

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: Well, we would but there's no one to canvass. We're looking at a pretty desolate area. There's really nobody out there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right, listen. You got help coming your way from our Salt Lake City office. I'm heading out there, too. There's a new angle we need to be looking at.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: What's that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That pay phone. Before Scully's call to me, the last call was placed on it was four days earlier, the night of the murder.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: Yeah?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It was placed to a Juliette Gulatarski. Of Fort Collins, Colorado. She tells me it was her brother Hank. He was on his way for a visit. Said he was stuck in the desert, but would be there in two days.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He never showed.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Something's happening.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's coming to. Hey. Can you hear me? How are you feeling?

speaker: HANK
line: I'm alive. And that's a start.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Oh, praise God.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Praise Him. Praise Him.

speaker: HANK
line: What's wrong with me?

speaker: HANK
line: I just need some rest. She can take care of me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's lucky they're still listening to you for the time being.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This... wound in your back... it seems to be a point of entry for a parasitic organism that has taken up residence along your spine. Now, this is something that I am completely unfamiliar with.

speaker: HANK
line: Oh, boy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know how far this extends or how to get it out of you without harming you.

speaker: HANK
line: Does that mean I'm dying?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You will die if we cannot treat you properly. Now, these people don't seem to want to let you go. I think that they put this thing inside of you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now, I have no idea what the motives of these people are-- whether it's some bizarre religious activity-- but they killed the last person who was in your condition and I'm afraid that they're going to try and kill you, too.

speaker: HANK
line: This is a lot to take in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No kidding.

speaker: HANK
line: What are you going to do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to try and get us the hell out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These, uh... people tell me that they have no cars. I don't believe them. They've got to have transportation hidden around here somewhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to go take a look around, okay?

speaker: HANK
line: You're not going to be gone long, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know how to use a gun?

speaker: HANK
line: Pretty much.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll be back soon.

speaker: HANK
line: The sooner the better.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Where did she go?

speaker: HANK
line: She says I'm dying.

speaker: HANK
line: We need another swap.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sherriff? Agent John Doggett.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: You made good time.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Good to know you.

speaker: BRIAN MAYFIELD
line: I'm Brian Mayfield, Salt Lake office. We're at your disposal.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Appreciate it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sheriff, does this wound look familiar?

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: It's the victim in our morgue. Where'd you get it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's not your murder victim. That's a photo of a John Doe found off a West Texas highway in 1991.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: Our guy has the same wound.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, I thought you were going to say that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Arizona, '93. New Mexico, '97. Nevada, '99. All four victims had their brains beaten out and were dumped in remote areas. All four cases are unsolved.

speaker: MAYFIELD
line: How'd you run these down?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully had me track down this first one. It noted glycoproteins at the crime scene which is what she found. This same wound kept showing up. These murders range throughout the southwest, zigzagging all over the desert. The more remote the better.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey. How'd you...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You had me convinced.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm a Federal Agent! At this moment, the FBI is searching for me!

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: They won't find you.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Talk to her.

speaker: HANK
line: Your life... is about to take a wonderful turn. You're going to become a part of something much, much greater than you are. You're going to be... so loved.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Amen. Amen.

speaker: ALL
line: Amen. Amen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! Ahhh!!! You son of a bitch!

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Amen!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You just murdered him!

speaker: ALL
line: Amen!

speaker: MR. MILSAP AND ALL
line: Amen! Amen! Amen! Amen! Amen!

speaker: ALL
line: Amen!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No! I'm pregnant! No! No, don't do this! I'm going to have a baby!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! Don't do this! No! I'm going to have a baby!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! No! No! No!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you put in me?! I'm going to get every last one of you bastards!

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: No.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: You'll love us. You'll protect us. You'll teach us, make us better than we are. We're taught not to envy, but I do envy you so. That you'll soon be one with him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Him?! That thing in my spine is a "him"?!

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Please. This is such a wonderful, wonderful thing... for you... and your unborn child. That last man just wasn't a suitable tabernacle. The thing of it is there's always the chance that your body won't fail him... that he'll be in you forever.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Help! Help! Help!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Good evening.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Good evening. You lost?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I may be. I'm way the hell off the main road, that's for sure.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: Can we help you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, I hope so. I'm, uh... looking for this woman. Have you seen her?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: No.

speaker: FEMALE BUS DRIVER
line: No.

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Can't say I have.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Help! Help!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: She would have been driving a rental car like mine. You sure she hasn't been through here?

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: No. We get so few visitors we remember each one pretty well.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right. Thanks for your time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Help! Help!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Sheriff, this is Doggett.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: I'm reading you, Agent Doggett. Where are you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: 20 miles off the state road, just north of the crime scene. Some kind of outpost. It's on your map. I'm getting a definite vibe from it. Just talked to a guy who had a gun in his pocket and I don't mean he was happy to see me.

speaker: SHERIFF CIOLINO
line: I'll send everybody I've got.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hurry. I can't wait for you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What in the hell...? Agent Scully...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: God all mighty. Agent Scully. Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett. Get me the hell out of here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can you walk?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. How far is your car?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's about a half a mile up the road.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know something closer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you hot-wire it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can I hot-wire it? Gone in 60 seconds, Jack. I'm going to strand these lunatics.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully... talk to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got to cut it out. Cut it out. Oh... Oh... Now it's going to come to my brain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cut it out of me now!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aah! Just do it, Doggett!

speaker: MR. MILSAP
line: Why?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ready to go?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I'm ready to go.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Grand Jury convenes today. All 47 cult members are sticking together. They're not offering up much defense other than that they're being persecuted for their religious beliefs.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They believe they worshipped Christ. That that thing was the Second Coming.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I, uh... I wanted to apologize. I … I left you out of this case, and that was a mistake on my part. It was almost a fatal mistake.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It was. You screwed up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And I won't do it again.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I appreciate it.
